result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William D Tatum

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William D Tatum appeared by video.  Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke appeared by video for William D Tatum. Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel has received discovery from the state. Case is in contest posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William D Tatum in court.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Tyler Tabin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for William D Tatum
Current: 2469 N 34th Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2022)
Prior: 2738 North 25th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant William D Tatum not in court.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 10/10/22 @ 1p
